etymology.description: Radical form of 仌(仌) (bīng, "cold") -> Two blocks of ice compressed and stylized -> 冫(冫) (bīng, "cold") radical
etymology.interpretation: 冫(冫) represents a compressed depiction of ice used as a radical form to express the concept of coldness. It visually communicates the idea of ice by simplifying multiple blocks into a streamlined form.

examples.chinese: 夜晚的湖面显得冫(夜晚的湖面顯得冫)。
examples.english: The lake's surface at night appears cold.

examples.chinese: 他的声音听起来冫(他的聲音聽起來冫)。
寒冬来临时(寒冬來臨時)，大地铺上一层冫(大地鋪上一層冫)。
examples.pinyin: Hándōng láilínshí, dàdì pū shàng yī céng bīng.
examples.english: When the cold winter arrives, the earth is covered with a layer of cold.
